summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 28, 2019. The sheets detail the irregular observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document's significance lies in its date, which is the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody, making it a key record of the facility's procedures and staffing at that critical time.

events.title: MCC New York SHU Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute observational checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York are documented throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log sheet from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU) dated July 28, 2019.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The log is signed off by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of review.
The date is significant as it is one day prior to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at this facility on July 29, 2019.
The document is a standard operational record, showing the facility's procedures for monitoring high-risk inmates.
